content.text:
<image 1> What does the shaded area represent? P(___< x < ___)

A. 5,6
B. 5,7
C. 6,7
D. 6,8

The shaded area in the graph represents the probability that a randomly chosen value of \(x\) is between 5 and 7. This is because the shaded area is the area under the curve of the cumulative distribution function (CDF) of the standard normal distribution, which is a bell-shaped curve that represents the probability density function (PDF) of the standard normal distribution.

The shaded area is not equal to 5 or 7, as these values are not on the x-axis of the graph. Therefore, the correct answer is B.
Now, output the final answer and nothing else:
